meanings.definition: A type of lace or trimming used in clothing.
meanings.sent1: She added delicate rebatos to the hem of her dress.
meanings.sent2: The wedding gown was embellished with intricate rebatos.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer playfully sewed rebatos onto the sleeves.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was like a canvas, with rebatos as the colorful brushstrokes.
meanings.sent5: The rebatos on the costume sparkled under the stage lights.

meanings.definition: To trim or adorn with rebatos.
meanings.sent1: She carefully rebatos the edges of the tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: The tailor rebatos the neckline of the blouse.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rebatos his hat with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent4: The artist rebatos the painting with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The gardener rebatos the garden path with colorful stones.

meanings.definition: A type of collar worn in the 16th and 17th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The portrait showed a noblewoman with an elaborate rebatos.
meanings.sent2: In historical movies, actors often wear rebatos to depict the era.
meanings.sent3: The costume designer created a modern twist on the classic rebatos.
meanings.sent4: The rebatos around his neck made him look like a royal figure.
meanings.sent5: The intricate rebatos added elegance to the period costume.
